intro: Cuphea adenophylla, commonly known as the velvetleaf cuphea, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Cuphea adenophylla is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a decorative plant.
